content:
Alya Abbott said:

Semi-relatedly, has there been brainstorming in the past about whether there's a way to make it easier to transition between composing stream messages and composing private messages?

Zulip actually supported this feature in like 2013! It got removed like 6 months later over my objections, basically because the UI for it was confusing. I am of the perspective that we should allow it; we just need the right iconography for it.
Oh, this must have been in the Zulip startup days. (Maybe even in the whatever-the-precursor-name-was days.)
I'm pretty sure I've been annoyed by this before.

assuming such a UI is actually "switching" between compose-for-stream and compose-pm, it would still make sense to have ways to proactively enter it in the state of choice. (uh, meaning, "start new PM" should maybe remain a separate button somewhere somehow)
Yeah, for sure. I just think it would make it more possible to make that choice a little harder to find (e.g. under an extra click).

Alex Dehnert said:

I'm pretty sure I've been annoyed by this before.

Yeah, me too. One common scenario for me is that I want to quote a message from a stream and reference it in a PM, so I use the > hotkey to start a reply, but then I need to do Ctrl+A, Ctrl+X, Esc, X, {specify recipient}, Ctrl+V to get my content into the new reply (or something equivalent using the mouse). Whereas if I wanted to do the same thing and send to a private stream, it's a lot simpler.
Yeah, I've done that too (in a more mouse-y way)!
What if we had an icon near the "x" to close the compose box? E.g. the "users" icon we use for group PMs to switch to PM, and a hash to switch from PM to a stream message?
And tooltips to explain what those are, e.g. "Switch to PM" and "Switch to stream message"?
maybe keep both icons visible, but with some selection indication? (so it doesn't look like you're labelling a stream message with a user icon, or vice versa)

i am curious how many people get to the PM compose screen from the "New Private Message" button vs clicking on the user in the main view vs clicking on the user in one of the sidebars. i feel like the right sidebar is the most intuitive place to go to start a PM, but I could be wrong about that.

I feel like the left sidebar makes the most sense to slack users, and just replying to a PM in an interleaved mode is the most obvious for me. both have the limitation that they only work for people already talking to you. the right sidebar feels slower to me, and I think I'm just used to using the button if I'm starting a new conversation. (both at least can involve autocomplete to find the right person)
I personally never use the right side bar, because I find it too overwhelming, and would rather rather pick from Zulip autocomplete. The right sidebar is probably nicer to use in a smaller org.
the button also feels more natural for starting a PM with multiple people
I generally navigate through Private mesages if I've talked to someone before, because that way I don't have to figure out if I've got the right person. (Again, this is mostly a large org challenge.)

Ken Clary said:

maybe keep both icons visible, but with some selection indication? (so it doesn't look like you're labelling a stream message with a user icon, or vice versa)

Yeah, I like that better!
I updated #3409 based on this discussion.

@Vlad Korobov are there designs in Figma for #3409? Is it going to look like
this (in GitHub issue) or is there a new design? What does it look like in stream mode and PM mode, in both light and dark mode?

thanks :)
#24878 is the current compose box design. The DM switcher is going into the stream dropdown menu (which is why that PR is a blocker for the feature).

Ohh yes

Alya Abbott said:

Alya Abbott said:

then add the "Switch" option to that input's values to complete the non-CSS changes we'd need to have this component work as designed. Does that plan sound good?

Than make sense to me... I can write up an issue (or edit the one we have) for the switcher in the dropdown approach.

I updated the issue description for #3409 according to my understanding of the proposal. We haven't explicitly discussed what one sees in the dropdown when starting from the PMs view, but I think it makes sense for all the streams to be there... Evy FYI
I didn't notice that you'd added a note at the bottom of the issue (because it had the original author's name/picture beside it). Got it!
Ah, yeah, I'll update #3409 again to be consistent with #24878, but the idea is basically the same as what's there already.
Updated.
Awesome, thanks!
